column4: Anyone know where I can find my "Session" options in Ubuntu 10?
Do you mean like KDE or Gnome "sessions"
Log-out and you should see a box on the bottom of your screen where you can choose your sessions
alt+f2 is not a command line, it's like a quick-launch
gotcha, do you know of a good quick-launch app that will replace gnome-panel?
I already use AWM, do those docks add a panel? All I need is an Alt-F2 launcher
the Alt+F2 launcher comes from Compiz. <sudo apt-get install compiz fusion-icon>
That will pop up an icon in the notification area. Right-click it and Select Window Manager as Compiz
AWM, eh? You need to put the notification area / indicator applet there
I am using gnome-panel and AWM
I have notification area, and it seems I am already using Compiz... it's already selected, but no Alt-F2 launcher still
Then it's the gnome-panel you need
/nod - seems so... I just don't need the panel... my AWM has everything on it I need
